data.name: User Login
data.description:
## Explaination
Creat a class that helps users log in.These are functions the class will include:  
- ```__init__(self,password)```  
This will creat a user with password.All types are supported.The user is not logged in now.
- ```login(self,password)```  
If the given password equals to the password that is registered,the user will log in and the function will return "login". If not, return "try_again".Note that one user only has 5 chances to log in.If the password is wrong for the fifth time,the user will be locked and the function will return "lock!".If a locked user tries to log in,return "locked".

  If the user has already logged in,return "You have already logged in!"
- ```logout(self)```  
This will log out the user and return "logout".If the user has already logged out,return "You have already logged out!"  
## Example  
```python
user1=user_login(123456)
user1.login(1)#should return "try_agian"
user1.login(2)#should return "try_agian"
user1.login(3)#should return "try_agian"
user1.login(4)#should return "try_agian"
user1.login(5)#should return "lock!"
user1.login(1)#should return "locked"
user2=user_login(123456)
user2.login(123456)#should return "login"
user2.login(123456)#should return "You are already logged in!"
user2.logout()#should return "logout"
user2.logout()#should return "You are already logged out!"
```
